instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message:
Device won't turn on when battery is plugged in .orange light is on when i plug in the charger the fans spin and then stop
current drawn 0.35a-0.45a

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message:
Please post as more information as needed.
Do you mean the machine turns on and runs correctly with charger alone (no battery)?

Check <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>.
Post F7040 voltage w/ and w/ battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message:
the fan spins and stops
<TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> =
 pin5 =16.66 volt 
pin 1,2,3 =12.13 volt -  pin 4 =15 volt

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message: I have another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> motherboard - image was coming but there was squareness , i removed the video card, this motherboard does the same thing  the fan spins and stops.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message:
"i removed the video card"
What this means?

The GPU is soldered on the MLB, there is no video card.
It can be disabled, as already posted on the forum.
Did you change <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> before?

"Post F7040 voltage w/ and w/ battery connected."
If you've posted ONE voltage only, does this mean is the same in both cases???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message:
step bay step <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B   fans spin and then stop 

battery installed

<TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> =
pin5 =16.66 volt
pin 1,2,3 =12.13 volt - pin 4 =15 volt 

battery not installed

<TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> =
pin5 =16.66 volt
pin 1,2,3 =12.13 volt - pin 4 =12,94 volt 

<CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> i didn't change  f7040 = 12,13 volt  same in both cases (battery not installed,battery installed )

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message:
I really don't understand why do you insist to post <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> all pins voltage.
I asked about ONE voltage point (F7040).
If you like to waste time, is your choice.

So you get incorrect <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage, 12.13V; no matters battery is connected, or not.
That means bad communication between SMC and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Did you disconnect BIL?

Post voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message:
Did you disconnect BIL? what does this mean

SDA = 0.514
SCL =0. 515

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message:
J6955.

Can't you measure voltage on SCL/SDA lines???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message:
you said measure the scl/sda line in diode mode, so I didn't measure voltage.

SDA = 3,474 Voltage and 3,0 voltage not fixed
SCL = 3,474 Voltage and 3,0 voltage not fixed

there are no sockets connected to the motherboard

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message:
"Post voltage and diode mode..."

With charger alone, the board turns on and restarts in few seconds?
Be aware, this board requires 85W charger to start (without battery).

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> steady high?
Did you try SMC bypass ?

threads.message:
Sorry for the wrong and incomplete reading.
original 85 watt adapter yes
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  = 3.482 Voltage still

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message: i tried SMC bypass  but the fan is not spinning and not power on, when i leave bypass , the fan keeps turning and stopping , it keeps doing the same thing it turns and stops

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message:
In SMC bypass should do same at least; just fan spins loudly.

SCL/SDA readings look good.
Try first changing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
If still incorrect <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, then need to change SMC.
Be sure first, <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> is good.

threads.message:

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?

threads.message:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message:
Boardview file shows another package for Power FETs; not only for this board.
But voltage power rail corresponds with schematic.
What's not clear then???

If you are not clear with <TRANSISTOR>Q7820</TRANSISTOR>, then check <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> anywhere else.
If <SIGNAL>PM_SUS_EN</SIGNAL> is present, <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> should be too; just need confirmation, to discard any <TRANSISTOR>Q7820</TRANSISTOR> issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boardview is missing a lot of net names. Use schematics to find pins and signals.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message: I checked it on pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R1847</RESISTOR> 3.3 volts stable

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not power on
threads.message: Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for pulse at each big coil; at same time when trigger the signal.
